abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about helping
            Poland's communities break through the barriers of
            poverty and isolation. Poland's economy has grown in
            the past decade and many Poles were well off, but large
            parts of the country remained poor particularly in rural
            areas. Poland's Post Accession Rural Support Project
            piloted a new approach in working with socially marginalized
            and excluded people through social integration efforts at
            the local municipality level. It has drawn together local
            government and an innovative and creative coalition of
            public and civil society agencies to improve social service
            delivery for tackling social exclusion. As a result,
            communities have been strengthened, relationships fostered,
            minds broadened and society's marginalized engaged.
